device.notSupported: We are sorry, your device is not supported

password.title: Admin password
password.placeholder: Provide device password if device is protected

hostname.title: Device hostname
hostname.placeholder: Device network name or IP address

validation.required: Please fill in device hostname or IP address

interface.title: Interface
interface.placeholder: The network interface to use. If none is specified, all available interfaces will be used.

requestTimeout.title: Request timeout
requestTimeout.placeholder: The time, in seconds, to wait for a response before a request is aborted.

validation.number: Request timeout must be a positive integer

staleTimeout.title: Stale timeout
staleTimeout.placeholder: The time, in seconds, before a device is considered offline if no status update is received.

validation.number: Stale timeout must be a positive integer

config.edited: Changes saved! The Shelly Gen 1 plugin config has been updated.
config.notEdited: Something went wrong. Shelly Gen 1 plugin config update was not successful.

devices.exists: Device with provided hostname and password is already registered in system.
devices.created: New Shelly Gen 1 device added successfully.
devices.notCreated: Something went wrong. Unable to create the Shelly Gen 1 device.
devices.notChecked: Something went wrong. Device information could not be loaded. Check the device hostname or password.
devices.notReachable: Device is not reachable. Please check the hostname or IP address.
devices.invalidPassword: Invalid password. Please check the device password.
devices.edited: Changes saved! The Shelly Gen 1 device: {device} has been updated.
devices.notEdited: Something went wrong. Shelly Gen 1 device update was not successful.
devices.failedLoadSupportedDevices: Something went wrong. Plugin supported devices could not be loaded.

texts.aboutPluginStatus: Enable or disable the Shelly Gen 1 device integration. When enabled, Shelly devices can be discovered and controlled through the Smart Panel.
texts.aboutDiscovery: Configure how the plugin discovers Shelly Gen 1 devices on your local network using Multicast DNS (mDNS). This enables automatic detection without needing to manually enter IP addresses.
texts.aboutTimeouts: Configure timeout settings for HTTP communication with Shelly Gen 1 devices. These settings control request handling and device state monitoring.
